alert.note: Alert for South Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Frost Advisory issued November 24 at 9:20PM PST until November 25 at 9:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 9 AM PST SATURDAY... ...FROST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 9 AM PST SATURDAY... ...FROST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 10 AM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 30 expected. For the first Frost Advisory, temperatures of 33 to 36 will result in frost formation. For the second Frost Advisory, temperatures as low as 33 will result in frost formation. * WHERE...South Central Oregon Coast. Frost conditions expected along the immediate coast Saturday from north of Reedsport down to near Port Orford. Freezing conditions Saturday through much of inland Coos County, including Myrtle Point, Coos Bay, Coquille, and Powers on Saturday. For Sunday morning, Frost conditions across the area. * WHEN...For the Freeze Warning and first Frost Advisory, from 2 AM to 9 AM PST Saturday. For the second Frost Advisory, from 4 AM to 10 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
